intro: Monolena grandiloba, commonly known as the large-lobed monolena, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae, which includes grass-like plants and is often found in wetland environments. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as marshes and along stream banks. Monolena grandiloba is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local biodiversity.
